issue.title: [Python][CI] Tests on windows are running very slow

labels.name: Priority: Blocker
labels.description: Marks a blocker for the release

repository.name: arrow
repository.description: Apache Arrow is the universal columnar format and multi-language toolbox for fast data interchange and in-memory analytics

issue.body:
Appveyor is currently timing out (eg https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/arrow/builds/46764558), and also the nightly crossbow wheel tests show very slow tests (eg [wheel-windows-cp310-amd64 latest logs](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions/runs/4676300747/jobs/8282436089)). 

Going back a bit in time, the same crossbow build from April 1 was fast: [logs](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions/runs/4582243569/jobs/8092338363) (tests take about 5 minutes)

body:
FWIW, we noticed this issue as well on the pyarrow test suite on Windows, where updating pytest from 7.2.2 to 7.3.0 increased the the time to run the test suite from around 5min to more than 1.5h. 
Updating our pytest settings to set `tmp_path_retention_policy` to "failed" (the previous default) fixes the slowdown for us (but it still seems an unexpectedly big slowdown?)

@jorisvandenbossche thanks! Definitely this is a regression that we need to look into.

I still have not found the time to look into this though, I'm afraid.

Took a 10 minutes break off work to see if I could reproduce the problem and maybe find the culprit, and I found it. :grin: 

The problem is the `cleanup_dead_symlink` call at the end of the `tmp_path` fixture. Moving that to `pytest_session_finish` the performance problem goes away.

Will open a PR later.

Thank you guys for the catch. I don't have a Windows environment with me but at least could confirm that the @nicoddemus's approach is correct and does not change the overall behavior of this `retention policy`.

I suppose I'll leave the work to @nicoddemus, but if you're really busy and want me to handle the PR, feel free to ask me.
Thanks @ykadowak. I will work on it later, thanks!

issue.title: Fix tmp_path regression introduced in 7.3.0

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
The problem is that we would loop over all directories of the basetemp directory searching for dead symlinks, for each test, which would compound over the test session run.

Doing the cleanup just once, at the end of the session, fixes the problem.

Fix #10896

body:
> Updating our pytest settings to set `tmp_path_retention_policy` to "failed" (the previous default) fixes the slowdown for us

To clarify: The previous default always *was* "all" - it's just that #10442 changed the default to "failed" (plus introduced the slowdown), and then #10609 changed it back to "all".
